marketNews.title: Top Gainers
marketNews.content: The following stocks were the biggest gainers on the day: PTRO (+18.37%), INET (+16.36%), BBYB (+11.02%), RAJA (+10.95%).

marketNews.title: Top Losers
marketNews.content: The following stocks were the biggest losers on the day: SMIL (-14.91%), UNVR (-4.86%), PGEO (-4.15%), UNIQ (-3.57%).

marketNews.title: U.S. President Donald Trump says the United States is talking with China on tariff talks
marketNews.content: President Donald Trump told Time magazine on Friday, April 25, that the United States government is in talks with China to reach a tariff agreement. Trump also claimed that Chinese President Xi Jinping has contacted him. The statement contradicts the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, which on the same day urged the United States to stop "misleading the public." Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Guo Jiakun said that the United States and China are not engaged in any negotiations on tariff issues.

marketNews.title: New regulation raises the maximum income limit for low-income households
marketNews.content: Housing and Settlement Minister Maruarar Sirait released a new regulation that raises the maximum income ceiling for low-income households (MBR) depending on the zone. For the Greater Jakarta area, the maximum MBR income becomes 12 million rupiah per month for single workers and 14 million rupiah per month for married workers. Previously, the maximum income for single workers was 7 million rupiah per month and 8 million rupiah per month for married workers.

marketNews.title: Sell in May and Go Away?
marketNews.content: "Sell in May if you must, but invest with brains, not fear." – Ruthmarthaamelias

tickerNews.title: BBNI reports net profit of 5.4 trillion rupiah in 1Q25, up 1% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI) recorded a net profit of 5.4 trillion rupiah in the first quarter of 2025, representing a 1% year-over-year increase and a 4.4% quarter-over-quarter increase, roughly in line with the consensus estimate of 23% of the 2025 forecast. Asset quality remained stable. Net interest income grew 4.7% YoY to 9.8 trillion rupiah, but the bank-only loan yield fell to 7.4% (down from 7.5% in 1Q24 and 7.9% in 4Q24) due to heightened competition, causing interest income to rise only 5.3% YoY despite a 10% YoY credit growth. Interest expense rose 6.1% YoY as the bank prioritized securing funding amid tight liquidity, pushing the bank-only cost of fund (CoF) to 2.8% (unchanged from 1Q24, up from 2.7% in 4Q24). Consequently, the net interest margin (NIM) slipped to 3.9% in 1Q25 (down from 4.0% in 1Q24 and 4.5% in 4Q24), below the management’s 2025 guidance range of 4.0%-4.2%. The loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) fell to 93% from 96% in December 2024, aligning with the 2025 target of staying below 95%. Management noted that liquidity improvement remains uncertain while the rupiah stays under pressure, despite a significant maturity of SRBI in the near term. Pre-provision operating profit (PPOP) grew only 1.6% YoY due to weak non-interest income, which fell 0.5% YoY, as fee income grew modestly 2.6% YoY and recovery income dropped 7.5% YoY. Credit cost (CoC) stood at 0.9% in 1Q25 (down from 1.0% in 1Q24 and 1.5% in 4Q24), slightly below the 2025 guidance of around 1% because of reversals on several corporate clients. Management kept the 2025 CoC guidance at about 1%. Non-performing loans (NPL) and loan-at-risk (LAR) remained stable at 2% and 10.9% respectively, unchanged from the end of 2024. Direct exposure to U.S. export clients accounted for about 3% of total credit. With stricter loan underwriting and adequate provisioning, management is optimistic that any change in the 2025 CoC guidance would not materially affect results. Overall, we remain neutral on BBNI’s 1Q25 performance. Management maintains its 2025 guidance but may revise it after the 2Q25 results.

tickerNews.title: DMAS declares dividend of Rp29 per share, indicating 16.3% yield
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Puradelta Lestari approved on Monday, April 28, a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah, or Rp29 per share. This corresponds to a 105% dividend payout ratio and implies a dividend yield of 16.3% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. In fiscal year 2023, DMAS did not pay a final dividend and only paid an interim dividend of Rp12 per share in December 2023.

tickerNews.title: UNTR plans to expand non-coal mineral portfolio with $500M-$1B annual budget
tickerNews.content: United Tractors director Iwan Hadiantoro said the company will enlarge its business portfolio in non-coal mineral sectors such as nickel, gold, copper, and silver. Iwan also explained that the company is considering expansion into bauxite and is conducting a study on lithium development. UNTR will allocate roughly USD 500 million to USD 1 billion per year to add to its non-coal mineral portfolio.

tickerNews.title: AADI shares purchased by Saratoga Investama Sedaya, increasing stake to 4.38%
tickerNews.content: Adaro Andalan Indonesia shareholders Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG) bought approximately 71.6 million AADI shares at an average price of Rp6,005 per share on April 21, 2025. The total transaction value was about Rp430 billion. After this transaction, SRTG’s ownership in AADI rose from 3.46% to 4.38%.

tickerNews.title: SCMA approves final dividend of Rp18 per share, yielding 8.8%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Surya Citra Media approved on Monday, April 28 a final dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 of Rp18 per share, indicating a final dividend yield of 8.8% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced. Previously, SCMA paid an interim dividend of Rp5 per share for fiscal year 2024 in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: DRMA reports net profit of Rp143 billion in 1Q25, up 7% YoY
tickerNews.content: Dharma Polimetal recorded a net profit of Rp143 billion in the first quarter of 2025, a 7% year-over-year increase but a 15% quarter-over-quarter decline, in line with the consensus estimate of 23% of the 2025 forecast (versus a 23% realization in 1Q24). Sales amounted to Rp1.5 trillion in 1Q25, up 9% YoY and down 2% QoQ, also matching the consensus estimate of 25% of the 2025 forecast. Strong growth in the motorcycle segment (+16% YoY) offset a decline in the automobile segment (-10% YoY). Net profit growth was mainly driven by other income, which nearly doubled year-over-year to Rp17 billion (up from Rp9 billion in 1Q24 and Rp20 billion in 4Q24). Operating profit was flat year-over-year at Rp171 billion (0% YoY, -15% QoQ) due to a lower gross profit margin of 11.7% (down from 12.8% in 1Q24 and 13.6% in 4Q24) and a 6% YoY increase in operating expenses.

tickerNews.title: PRDA approves dividend of Rp172.92 per share, yielding 6.2%
tickerNews.content: Prodia Widyahusada shareholders approved on Monday, April 28 a dividend plan for fiscal year 2024 amounting to approximately Rp162.1 billion, or Rp172.92 per share, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of about 60% and indicating a dividend yield of 6.2% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: PGEO posts net loss of $31 million in 1Q25, down 34% YoY
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy recorded a net loss of $31 million in the first quarter of 2025, a 34% year-over-year decline but an 18% quarter-over-quarter improvement, missing the consensus estimate of a 20% loss for 2025. The annual loss was mainly driven by an increase in cost of goods sold to $43 million (up 7% YoY and 32% QoQ) and a foreign exchange loss of $9 million (versus a $5 million gain in 1Q24 and a $3 million gain in 4Q24). However, PGEO still reported EBITDA of $84 million in 1Q25, down 2% YoY but up 21% QoQ.

tickerNews.title: BNGA plans spin-off of its sharia banking unit
tickerNews.content: CIMB Niaga intends to spin off its sharia business unit by establishing a sharia commercial bank named PT Bank CIMB Niaga Syariah. The corporate action is undertaken to comply with POJK No. 12/2023. The plan will be discussed at the shareholders meeting scheduled for June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PANI reports marketing sales of Rp466 billion in 1Q25, down 69% YoY
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua recorded marketing sales of Rp466 billion in the first quarter of 2025, a 69% year-over-year decline and a 65% quarter-over-quarter decline, representing 9% of the 2025 target. At the same time, Bangun Kosambi Sukses (CBDK) reported marketing sales of Rp239 billion in 1Q25, down 74% YoY and 65% QoQ, representing 12% of the 2025 target. In an analyst meeting in April 2025, management had forecast soft marketing sales for 1Q25. Management explained that the decline for PANI was caused by lower consumer confidence, while the decline for CBDK stemmed from allocating part of the land to an investment property project, including the construction of the Nusantara International Convention and Exhibition (NICE) expected to start partial operations in October 2025. Management remains optimistic about future marketing sales, supported by the partial operation of the Kataraja toll road.

tickerNews.title: ARNA announces share buyback program up to Rp100 billion
tickerNews.content: Arwana Citramulia plans to conduct a share buyback with a funding allocation of up to Rp100 billion between April 29 and July 29, 2025, although the company did not disclose the maximum number of shares to be repurchased. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, following the relaxation granted by the OJK to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: TPMA to buy back up to 100 million shares (2.85%) with funding of Rp80 billion
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine intends to buy back up to 100 million shares, representing 2.85% of its share capital, with a funding allocation of up to Rp80 billion between April 29 and July 28, 2025. The plan does not require shareholder meeting approval, in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support market stability.

tickerNews.title: WINS reports net profit of $1.6 million in 1Q25, down 41% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Wintermar Offshore Marine recorded a net profit of $1.6 million in the first quarter of 2025, a 41% quarter-over-quarter decline and a 26% year-over-year decline. The loss was caused by a 20% QoQ drop in revenue and a 23% QoQ increase in operating expenses. Revenue declined across all segments, especially the owned-vessel segment, which fell 13% QoQ and contributed about 89% of total revenue in 1Q25. The decline in the owned-vessel segment resulted from the expiration of mid-tier spot contracts and slower demand due to project delays. Vessel utilization in 1Q25 dropped to 57% (down from 63% in 4Q24).

tickerNews.title: FILM plans rights issue of approximately 990 million new shares
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment intends to conduct a rights issue of about 990 million new shares, resulting in a dilution of up to 9.09%. The issue price has not been announced, and the proceeds will be used to repay debt to Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and for working capital. The controlling shareholders, PT MD Corp Enterprises and Manoj Dhamoo Punjabi, will exercise their full rights. The rights will be listed on the regular market and negotiated on May 7, 2025, with the subscription period from July 10 to July 18, 2025.

tickerNews.title: DOID shareholders sell 340 million shares to Northstar Tambang Persada
tickerNews.content: The shareholders of BUMA International Group (DOID), Northstar Tambang Persada Ltd., sold 340 million DOID shares at a price of Rp406 per share on April 23, 2025. The total transaction value was Rp138 billion. After the transaction, Northstar Tambang Persada’s ownership in DOID decreased from 42.661% to 38.217%.

tickerNews.title: AKRA approves 2024 dividend of approximately Rp2 trillion, yielding 4.2%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of AKR Corporindo approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of roughly Rp2 trillion, corresponding to an 88% dividend payout ratio and indicating a final dividend of Rp50 per share with a final dividend yield of 4.2% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date is on the regular market and the negotiation date is May 7, 2025, with payment scheduled for May 22, 2025. Previously, AKRA paid an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of Rp987 billion, or Rp50 per share, in August 2024.

tickerNews.title: AALI declares 2024 dividend of Rp184 per share, yielding 3.1%
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Astra Agro Lestari approved on Monday, April 28 a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of Rp515.8 billion, or approximately Rp184 per share, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of about 45% and indicating a final dividend yield of 3.1% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date has not been announced, while payment is scheduled for May 28, 2025. Previously, AALI paid an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 of Rp84 per share in October 2024. In addition to the dividend, AALI also appointed Djap Tet Fa as the new president director, replacing Santosa.

tickerNews.title: ELPI announces dividend of Rp13.5 per share, yielding 3.6%
tickerNews.content: Pelayaran Nasional Ekalya Purnamasari approved a dividend for fiscal year 2024 of approximately Rp100 billion, or Rp13.5 per share, corresponding to a dividend payout ratio of about 40% and indicating a dividend yield of 3.6% as of Monday, April 28. The cum-date is on the regular market and the negotiation date is May 5, 2025, with payment scheduled for May 23, 2025.

tickerNews.title: PTRO reports net profit of $1 million in 1Q25, up 464% YoY
tickerNews.content: Petrosea recorded a net profit of $1 million in the first quarter of 2025, a 464% year-over-year increase but an 87% quarter-over-quarter decline. The annual profit surge was mainly driven by a 2% YoY reduction in cost of goods sold and a 7% YoY decrease in operating expenses. Additionally, a foreign exchange gain of $7 million contributed to the result (versus a $4 million gain in 1Q24 and an $8 million gain in 4Q24).

tickerNews.title: SILO acquires 2,036 square meters of land in Makassar
tickerNews.content: Siloam International Hospitals acquired a land parcel of 2,036 square meters in the Mariso district of Makassar from an affiliated party. The total transaction value was Rp42.2 billion. The acquisition aligns with Siloam's expansion plan for its Makassar hospital.
